title: Area Information for Collier Street, Islington, London, N1 9QZ
content: Area Information for Collier Street, Islington, London, N1 9QZ This page combines information for the address Collier Street, Islington, London, N1 9QZ, and the neighbourhood in which it resides. The information on housing, people, culture, employment and education that is displayed about Collier Street, Islington, London, N1 9QZ is based on the last census performed in the UK in 2021. The area containing Collier Street, Islington, London contains a higher-than-average level of social housing - 78% of household spaces. In this area (Collier Street, Islington, London), 50% of the residents were born in the United Kingdom, which is significantly below the UK average. Collier Street, Islington, London, N1 9QZ is within the Caledonian policing neighbourhood, under the Metropolitan Police Service force area.

title: Showstopper! The Improvised Musical
content: The incredible ‘Showstopper! The Improvised Musical’ has extended their residency in the West End at the Cambridge Theatre for the third year with.....
location: Leicester Square Theatre, 6 Leicester Pl, London WC2H 7BX

sections.content:
Showstopper! The Improvised Musical


Leicester Square Theatre, 6 Leicester Pl, London WC2H 7BX


view on map




Today

7.30pm £20











Buy Tickets





07710469141
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

Showstopper! The Improvised Musical

The incredible ‘Showstopper! The Improvised Musical’ has extended their residency in the West End at the Cambridge Theatre for the third year with new dates added throughout 2025!  Spontaneous musical comedy at its finest, this is the first ever long-form improv show to have a full West End run and to be nominated and win an Olivier Award! Completely improvised and genuinely entirely different every night, this is a must-see show!  For those who haven’t yet experienced the live phenomenon that is ‘Showstopper! The Improvised Musical’, the show is a fully realised musical created on the spot from audience suggestions. The cast transform suggestions for settings, genres, musical styles and even the name of the show into ingenious storylines with hilarious characters. From Lin Manuel Miranda to Stephen Sondheim, via a primary school, Ancient Egypt, or a mattress shop – if the audience can suggest it, The Showstoppers will perform it. It’s hugely funny to watch.

llm_output.description: Spontaneous musical comedy at its finest, this is the first ever long-form improv show to have a full West End run and to be nominated and win an Olivier Award! Completely improvised and genuinely entirely different every night, this is a must-see show!
llm_output.location: Leicester Square Theatre, 6 Leicester Pl, London WC2H 7BX

title: JITR Jan: Empirical, Pedro Velasco + Emily Tran
content: EMPIRICAL @empiricalmusicFeaturing Nathaniel Facey (alto sax), Tom Farmer (double bass), Lewis Wright (vibraphone) and Shaney Forbes (drums), the...
location: The Cockpit, Gateforth Street NW8 8EH

sections.content:
JITR Jan: Empirical, Pedro Velasco + Emily Tran


The Cockpit, Gateforth Street, London NW8 8EH


view on map




Today

Standard: £15Students / MU members: Half Price






www.thecockpit.org.uk/show/jitr_jan_empirical_pedro_velasco_emily_tran






Buy Tickets





020 7258 2925
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

JITR Jan: Empirical, Pedro Velasco + Emily Tran

EMPIRICAL @empiricalmusicFeaturing Nathaniel Facey (alto sax), Tom Farmer (double bass), Lewis Wright (vibraphone) and Shaney Forbes (drums), the quartet bonded through a sense of common purpose: “I’d never met guys who took it so seriously. The process of studying together is really what brought us together, and we just carried on doing it” recalls Tom Farmer. Collective study and exploration has remained the bedrock of Empirical’s creative process and has seen the band assimilate influences from right across the rich history of jazz. While oblique harmonies, translucent textures and jagged, quick shifting rhythms are the signposts of Empirical’s musical territory, the band has not been afraid to explore other musical realms. Alongside their ceaselessly fearless creative fervour, Empirical have succeeded in establishing an instantly recognisable group sound that is rife with raw energy and roiling emotion. Despite the intellectualism often ascribed to jazz, for Empirical, it’s ultimately all about moving, rather than impressing, their audience.  PEDRO VELASCO @pedrovelascomusicPedro Velasco is a London-based guitarist who specialises in improvised music. Born in Lisbon, Portugal, he began playing piano at age nine and, inspired by the Brazilian music he was surrounded by at home, picked up a guitar at age 12. Under the tutelage of renowned Portuguese guitarist Mario Delgado, he began turning to the sounds of jazz and improvised music. He moved to London in 2003 to study at Middlesex University with Nikki Iles, Chris Batchelor and Stuart Hall and in 2007 he graduated with a first-class honours degree in Music (Jazz Performance). He performs prolifically across the UK, and Europe with several projects including Harry Christelis and Pedro Velasco duo who recently released their debut album Scribbling to critical acclaim.

llm_output.description:
EMPIRICAL @empiricalmusic
Featuring Nathaniel Facey (alto sax), Tom Farmer (double bass), Lewis Wright (vibraphone) and Shaney Forbes (drums), the quartet bonded through a sense of common purpose: “I’d never met guys who took it so seriously. The process of studying together is really what brought us together, and we just carried on doing it” recalls Tom Farmer. Collective study and exploration has remained the bedrock of Empirical’s creative process and has seen the band assimilate influences from right across the rich history of jazz. While oblique harmonies, translucent textures and jagged, quick shifting rhythms are the signposts of Empirical’s musical territory, the band has not been afraid to explore other musical realms. Alongside their ceaselessly fearless creative fervour, Empirical have succeeded in establishing an instantly recognisable group sound that is rife with raw energy and roiling emotion. Despite the intellectualism often ascribed to jazz, for Empirical, it’s ultimately all about moving, rather than impressing, their audience. 
 PEDRO VELASCO @pedrovelascomusic
Pedro Velasco is a London-based guitarist who specialises in improvised music. Born in Lisbon, Portugal, he began playing piano at age nine and, inspired by the Brazilian music he was surrounded by at home, picked up a guitar at age 12. Under the tutelage of renowned Portuguese guitarist Mario Delgado, he began turning to the sounds of jazz and improvised music. He moved to London in 2003 to study at Middlesex University with Nikki Iles, Chris Batchelor and Stuart Hall and in 2007 he graduated with a first-class honours degree in Music (Jazz Performance). He performs prolifically across the UK, and Europe with several projects including Harry Christelis and Pedro Velasco duo who recently released their debut album Scribbling to critical acclaim.

title: The Devil May Care
content: George Bernard Shaw’s The Devil’s Disciple is revived in this electrifying new adaptation.Judith, the wife of a disgraced English minister wanted.....
location: 77-85 Newington Causeway SE1 6BD

sections.content:
The Devil May Care


77-85 Newington Causeway London SE1 6BD


view on map




Wed 8 Jan to Saturday 1 February

8:00 PM£10.00 - £25.00






southwarkplayhouse.co.uk/productions/the-devil-may-care/






Buy Tickets





020 7407 0234
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

The Devil May Care

George Bernard Shaw’s The Devil’s Disciple is revived in this electrifying new adaptation. Judith, the wife of a disgraced English minister wanted for treason, witnesses the arrest of disreputable American trader and “disciple of the devil” Richard Conroe. The American army is convinced he is her husband – but when Judith tries to reveal their mistake, Richard denies her claims and refuses to save himself from execution.Why would an innocent man insist on sacrificing himself for a stranger? Against the chaos of The Philippine – American War, otherwise known as “America’s First Vietnam”, the world premiere of The Devil May Care is a timely exploration of Western power, the ripples of which we are still feeling today. Starring Callum Woodhouse (All Creatures Great and Small, The Durrells) and Jill Greenacre (The Brittas Empire) this is an opportunity to experience the best of rising and established TV talent, live on stage.

The American army is convinced he is her husband – but when Judith tries to reveal their mistake, Richard denies her claims and refuses to save himself from execution.
Why would an innocent man insist on sacrificing himself for a stranger?
Against the chaos of The Philippine – American War, otherwise known as “America’s First Vietnam”, the world premiere of The Devil May Care is a timely exploration of Western power, the ripples of which we are still feeling today.

title: Canned Goods
content: “If you tell a big enough lie and tell it frequently enough – it will be believed.”It’s 1939. On the border between Germany and Poland, the.....
location: Southwark Playhouse Borough, The Large, 77-85 Newington Causeway, London SE1 6BD

sections.content:
Canned Goods


Southwark Playhouse Borough, The Large, 77-85 Newington Causeway, London SE1 6BD


view on map




Thu 16 Jan to Saturday 8 February

Tickets from £16, 7:30pm






southwarkplayhouse.co.uk/productions/canned-goods/






Buy Tickets





020 7407 0234
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

Canned Goods

“If you tell a big enough lie and tell it frequently enough – it will be believed.” It’s 1939. On the border between Germany and Poland, the shadow of fascism is inching closer. Hitler has a plan: stage a violent Polish attack on a German-speaking radio station, and use the attack to justify a Nazi invasion. But how do you pull off an act of deception designed to keep the UK from entering into a World War? German farmer Franciszek Honiok finds himself arrested and imprisoned in a jail cell on the border. Alongside him are two prisoners from Dachau: a Jewish philosopher and a German janitor. As the mission looms closer and tensions build, the three men must wrestle with an impossible unknown. Can they survive a plan much bigger than themselves? And are they the ‘canned goods’ their captors keep discussing? Making its London premiere after several critically acclaimed US runs, Canned Goods tells the gripping true story of a little-known – but pivotal – moment in history. Still relevant today, Erik Kahn’s edge-of-your seat thriller explores the knife edge of propaganda, ‘fake news’ and how those in power bend the truth for their own agenda.

llm_output.description: Making its London premiere after several critically acclaimed US runs, Canned Goods tells the gripping true story of a little-known – but pivotal – moment in history. Still relevant today, Erik Kahn’s edge-of-your seat thriller explores the knife edge of propaganda, ‘fake news’ and how those in power bend the truth for their own agenda.

sections.content:

Hampstead Theatre, Eton Avenue, Swiss Cottage, London NW3 3EU


view on map

Running Time: 70 minutesSuggested age guidance 14+Ticket PricesPreviews: £10Premium: £35Standard: £28Seniors (matinees only): £18 (Standard) / £21 (Premium)Under 30s/Students: £10






www.hampsteadtheatre.com/whats-on/2024/an-interrogation






Buy Tickets





020 7722 9301
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

An Interrogation

Joanna Nelson has been missing for 68 hours, and with every second that passes, D.C Ruth Palmer’s hope of finding her dwindles. The young detective sits down to interview someone who looks like the least likely person to be linked to this investigation. He’s a devoted son, a successful businessman and a respectable member of society. But as the minutes slip away, the detective starts to suspect that all is not what it seems… Following a sell-out run and rave reviews at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival 2023, the award-winning An Interrogation comes to Hampstead Downstairs. Inspired by real events, this gripping new play from Jamie Armitage (who also directs) is a thrilling debut from the co-director of the worldwide phenomenon SIX: The Musical. ‘Unpredictable and tense …a must see.’ - Broadway World ‘A chilling psychological play that has you on the edge of your seat.’ - The Guardian Co-produced with Ellie Keel Productions

Spread the word

About this Event

Under the Table by Aaron Thakar

A heartbroken actor forges an unexpected connection. A disillusioned voter takes drastic action. A disgraced radio host fights to reclaim his reputation. And as a secret auction begins, hidden agendas come to light.  As four loosely connected plays weave together, sex, politics, money, and religion intertwine in a caustic reflection of contemporary Britain.  Following his ‘immensely promising debut’ Artifically Yours at Riverside Studios (The Reviews Hub), Aaron Thakar joins Itchy Feet Theatre and Parkhouse Theatres in this original co-production. ‘Thakar is someone to watch out for’ (The Spy in the Stalls).

title: Plant Power - an exhibition of sculpture by Annie Trevorah
content: With her sculptures Annie Trevorah conjures an alien species defined by adaptive features that safeguard survival in a precarious future...
location: HS Projects, 12 Hammersmith Grove, London W6 7AP

sections.content:
Plant Power - an exhibition of sculpture by Annie Trevorah


HS Projects, 12 Hammersmith Grove, London W6 7AP






Today to Thu 30 Jan

2 December 2024 - 30 May 2025 HS Projects, 12 Hammersmith Grove, London W6 7APPlant Power is located a short walk from Hammersmith station. The exhibition is visible 24/7 and open to visitors between 10am and 6pm from Monday to Friday






hsprojects.com/





020 7487 5448
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

Plant Power - an exhibition of sculpture by Annie Trevorah

With her sculptures Annie Trevorah conjures an alien species defined by adaptive features that safeguard survival in a precarious future. Her part human/ part plant hybrids have stood their ground in galleries, parks and gardens. Plant Power marks their propagation into the hustle and bustle of an office environment.  Showcasing twelve works including a painting to introduce a new body of work dedicated to the maritime realm, groups of sensual cyborgs and symbiotic totems are huddled in opposite corners, exchanging water cooler stories under the watchful gaze of their mutant supervisors, whose predatory and fallible characteristics serve as reminders of the effects of climate change on all life-forms. Fusing organic and synthetic materials into intriguing monuments to human-plant interconnectivity, Trevorah merges eco-feminist theory with subtle humour to encourage reflection and reassurance

llm_output.description:
With her sculptures Annie Trevorah conjures an alien species defined by adaptive features that safeguard survival in a precarious future. Her part human/ part plant hybrids have stood their ground in galleries, parks and gardens. Plant Power marks their propagation into the hustle and bustle of an office environment. 
Showcasing twelve works including a painting to introduce a new body of work dedicated to the maritime realm, groups of sensual cyborgs and symbiotic totems are huddled in opposite corners, exchanging water cooler stories under the watchful gaze of their mutant supervisors, whose predatory and fallible characteristics serve as reminders of the effects of climate change on all life-forms.
Fusing organic and synthetic materials into intriguing monuments to human-plant interconnectivity, Trevorah merges eco-feminist theory with subtle humour to encourage reflection and reassurance
llm_output.event_name: Plant Power - an exhibition of sculpture by Annie Trevorah
llm_output.location: HS Projects, 12 Hammersmith Grove, London W6 7AP

title: Mars in the Painted Hall
content: Luke Jerram’s astonishing installation Mars is coming to the Painted Hall this winter. Following the sell-out success of Gaia and Museum of the Moon,.....
location: Painted Hall, Old Royal Naval College SE10 9NN

sections.content:
Mars in the Painted Hall


Painted Hall, Old Royal Naval College, London SE10 9NN


view on map




Tuesday 24 Dec 2024 to Tomorrow

£16.50











Buy Tickets





+44 (0)20 8269 4799
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

Mars in the Painted Hall

Luke Jerram’s astonishing installation Mars is coming to the Painted Hall this winter. Following the sell-out success of Gaia and Museum of the Moon, Mars will complete the trilogy of Jerram’s out-of-this-world installations at the iconic Old Royal Naval College. Measuring seven metres in diameter, this spellbinding artwork features detailed NASA imagery of the Martian surface recreated to scale. Slowly rotating against the spectacular backdrop of the Painted Hall, this unique pairing will bring two breathtaking works of art together, merging science with history, myth and allegory. “Mars follows on from my other astronomical artworks Museum of the Moon and Gaia presented in the awe-inspiring Painted Hall and allows a close encounter with the Martian planet. I hope that visitors will feel transported to its inhospitable desert wasteland and in comparison, really value our life on Earth.” – Luke Jerram.

About this Event

Acton Community Gardens – Term 2 Roll Back into Action

 Hey There, RollaDome Alumni,  We’ve missed you on the skating rink! Are you ready to put those skates back on? Now’s the perfect time to rejoin the fun and excitement of RollaDome All Skate in the Acton area!   Why Rejoin Our Club?   Revive Your Skills: Been a while? No worries! We’ll have you skating with the same flair and confidence as before.  Easier on Your Pocket: We know times are tough, but we’ve made it more affordable for you to return, thanks to the support of Young Ealing Foundation!  Friendly Environment: Reunite with old friends and make some new ones in our family-friendly, inclusive space.  Upgraded Lessons: We’ve revamped our programs, ensuring a thrilling and enriching skating experience!  Important Notice:?If the participant has any SEND (Special Educational Needs and Disabilities), is autistic, or has learning difficulties, please note that an additional form will need to be filled out, as you may require 1-to-1 sessions. Kindly complete this additional form – tinyurl.com/2b5rzcpd  Dress Code: Make sure you’re dressed for skating success—jog bottoms, leggings, or shorts. No jeans, skirts, ties, school uniforms or dresses. And remember to bring along a hydrating drink!   Mark Your Calendars!  Date: 13th January – 31st March 2025 every MondayBeginners Session: 4:00 PM – 5:00 PMReturners Session: 5:00 PM – 6: 00 PMThere’s no better time to rediscover the joys of roller skating. Whether you’re looking to refine your skills or just to have an amazing time, we’ve got you covered!   Rekindle Your Love for Skating and Glide Back into the RollaDome Family!   £17.00 – £165.00

llm_output.description: RollaDome skating lessons are back! Rejoin the fun in Acton. Revive your skills, enjoy an affordable activity, and connect with friends in an inclusive environment. Upgraded lessons and a friendly atmosphere await. Dress code: jog bottoms, leggings, or shorts. No jeans, skirts, ties, school uniforms, or dresses. Bring a drink. Dates: January 13th - March 31st, 2025, every Monday. Beginners: 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM, Returners: 5:00 PM - 6:00 PM.

title: Galapagos
content: A story between stories... The clock’s pendulum suspends... For a new tale to start, The old tale must end.....
location: Jacksons Lane269a Archway RoadLondon N6 5AA

sections.content:
Galapagos


Jacksons Lane
269a Archway Road
London N6 5AA


view on map




Tue 28 Jan to Sunday 2 February

Tuesday 28 January – Sunday 2nd February at 3pm & 7:30pmTickets £16 - £25






www.jacksonslane.org.uk/events/galapagos/






Buy Tickets





02083405226
for latest times or cancellations.



                        Organised by
                        Jacksons Lane
Spread the word

About this Event

Galapagos

A story between stories... The clock’s pendulum suspends... For a new tale to start, The old tale must end... Set sail on a breathtaking journey through the imagination where young heroes fight to outwit the world’s richest man, save Mother Nature from destruction and pilot an fantastical Arck made of old books to the land of Galapagos.   This modern myth of courage, rebellion, and hope takes us from the edge of space to the depths of the ocean. At its centre is the fearless orphan Juno who is living alone on a mountain of trash until she’s chosen for an impossible mission.     It’s a thrilling, high-energy ride for audiences young and old. Prepare to be swept up in the magic of physical theatre, puppetry, and live music, all performed by the UK's finest talent from Flabbergast Theatre, Complicite and Created a Monster. With song, dance and a powerful score played on repurposed trash instruments, this world premiere is unlike anything you’ve seen  - or heard - before! Join us at the very start of this awe-inspiring global tour—an adventure that reminds us of the power of hope, imagination, and the boundless spirit of the young.

A story between stories...
The clock’s pendulum suspends...
For a new tale to start,
The old tale must end...
Set sail on a breathtaking journey through the imagination where young heroes fight to outwit the world’s richest man, save Mother Nature from destruction and pilot an fantastical Arck made of old books to the land of Galapagos.
This modern myth of courage, rebellion, and hope takes us from the edge of space to the depths of the ocean. At its centre is the fearless orphan Juno who is living alone on a mountain of trash until she’s chosen for an impossible mission.
It’s a thrilling, high-energy ride for audiences young and old. Prepare to be swept up in the magic of physical theatre, puppetry, and live music, all performed by the UK's finest talent from Flabbergast Theatre, Complicite and Created a Monster. With song, dance and a powerful score played on repurposed trash instruments, this world premiere is unlike anything you’ve seen  - or heard - before!
Join us at the very start of this awe-inspiring global tour—an adventure that reminds us of the power of hope, imagination, and the boundless spirit of the young.

London N6 5AA

About this Event

Play On!

The cast has been announced for the UK premiere of Play On!, the jazz-fuelled, Twelfth Night-inspired musical that will tour the UK from September 2024 – February 2025, including a winter run at Lyric Hammersmith.  From Talawa, the UK’s outstanding Black theatre company, this joyous, musical retelling of Shakespeare’s beloved play brings to life the 1940s New York jazz scene, set to a timeless, toe-tapping Duke Ellington score.

title: Play On!
content: A Jazz musical based on Shakespeare’s “Twelfth Night”What does it take for a woman to make it in a man’s world?...
location: Lyric Hammersmith Theatre,Lyric Square,King St, London W6 0QL

sections.content:
Play On!


Lyric Hammersmith Theatre,
Lyric Square,
King St, London W6 0QL


view on map




Tue 28 Jan, Sat 22 Feb

Tickets: From £10Running time: 150 minutesAges: 12+Venue: Main House






lyric.co.uk/






Buy Tickets





020 8741 6850
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

Play On!

A Jazz musical based on Shakespeare’s “Twelfth Night” What does it take for a woman to make it in a man’s world? Meet Vy, a talented songwriter looking to make it big in the 1940’s Harlem scene. She quickly learns from her uncle Jester that women will never be taken seriously in a man’s world. But, like many a strong hero, she refuses to accept defeat. Through her gender fluid cunning, she meets club owner The Duke and sensational nightclub singer Lady Liv and is swept up in a syncopated symphony of melodies, mistaken identities and romance. Who will come out on top?  Play On! is set in the jazz scene of New York’s Cotton Club. This stylish retelling of Shakespeare’s Twelfth Night, directed by Talawa’s Artistic Director Michael Buffong (A Kind of People, Royal Court; All My Sons, Talawa and Royal Exchange) fuses the thrilling music of Duke Ellington with street dance choreography. Prepare to be wowed by this musical spectacular that will have your toes tapping and hands clapping along with the timeless soundtrack.

llm_output.description:
A Jazz musical based on Shakespeare’s “Twelfth Night”
 What does it take for a woman to make it in a man’s world?
 Meet Vy, a talented songwriter looking to make it big in the 1940’s Harlem scene. She quickly learns from her uncle Jester that women will never be taken seriously in a man’s world. But, like many a strong hero, she refuses to accept defeat. Through her gender fluid cunning, she meets club owner The Duke and sensational nightclub singer Lady Liv and is swept up in a syncopated symphony of melodies, mistaken identities and romance. Who will come out on top? 
 Play On! is set in the jazz scene of New York’s Cotton Club. This stylish retelling of Shakespeare’s Twelfth Night, directed by Talawa’s Artistic Director Michael Buffong (A Kind of People, Royal Court; All My Sons, Talawa and Royal Exchange) fuses the thrilling music of Duke Ellington with street dance choreography.
 Prepare to be wowed by this musical spectacular that will have your toes tapping and hands clapping along with the timeless soundtrack.

Lyric Hammersmith Theatre,
Lyric Square,
King St, London W6 0QL

title: FREE taster session with the Ealing Rock Choir
content: Do you want to join a choir near you? Your local Ealing choir is run by London based musician Nicola Cain...
location: Grange Primary School, Church Gardens, Ealing W5 4HN

sections.content:
FREE taster session with the Ealing Rock Choir


Grange Primary School, Church Gardens, Ealing, London W5 4HN


view on map




Tue 28 Jan, Tue 11 Feb, Tue 25 Feb, Tue 11 Mar

Start time: 7:30 PM. Make sure you book online at the Website link below.






www.rockchoir.com/join/ealing_late_session
Spread the word

About this Event

FREE taster session with the Ealing Rock Choir

Do you want to join a choir near you?  Your local Ealing choir is run by London based musician Nicola Cain. A local community choir first and foremost, we are also part of the national Rock Choir network, which provides some unequalled performances for choir members. Members of Rock Choir have had the chance to meet and sing in front of many celebrities and public figures, including Will Smith, Alan Titchmarsh and Jonathan Ross at the UK's top venues including Wembley Stadium! We rehearse every week during the school calendar and you can come along to any rehearsal that is convenient to you for your FREE trial session. You can book for you and your friends at https://www.rockchoir.com/join. What are you waiting for? It's a FREE singing session near you! Here is a quote about our choir - 'It's all been said already, but Rock Choir is just the best, most fun and most uplifting experience ever. The more people that join, the happier this country will be. ' - Teresa (Rock Choir member) Rock Choir is a winner of the Red Ribbon 'Big Heart' Award. and holds 1 former and 2 current Guinness World Records. The choir is also credited with single handedly starting the contemporary choir movement.

title: Just A Few Words and Piano Smashers
content: A double bill of two award-winning/nominated solo fringe shows.JUST A FEW WORDSJust a few words to say how you feel. Shouldn’t take long...
location: The Cockpit, Gateforth Street NW8 8EH

sections.content:
Just A Few Words and Piano Smashers


The Cockpit, Gateforth Street, London NW8 8EH


view on map




Wednesday 29 January and Thursday 30 January

Date:29 to 30 Jan - 7pmTickets:Standard: £12Concessions: £10






www.thecockpit.org.uk/show/just_a_few_words_and_piano_smashers






Buy Tickets





020 7258 2925
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

Just A Few Words and Piano Smashers

A double bill of two award-winning/nominated solo fringe shows. JUST A FEW WORDS Just a few words to say how you feel. Shouldn’t take long. Except, StammerMouth has a stammer, and his speech is lost as a nagging pile of thoughts won't stop interrupting him… This may take a while. A darkly comic grapple with the awkward task of expression, inviting you into the mind of a person who stammers. Partnered with Unlimited; the British Stammering Association; the University of Chichester;  the Mike Howley Trust. Winner of the TicketSource Festival Favourite Award at Cardiff Fringe 2018. www.stammermouth.co.uk/just-a-few-words PIANO SMASHERS 'Such hidden gems add greatly to the Fringe experience and remind us that among the thousands of shows, there are superb ones which don’t get the audiences they deserve.Piano Smashers is one such show.' Edinburgh Reporter. 2024. Piano Smashers is a new play by Rupert Page and Rob Thompson in which a mother bequeaths a precious piano to her children in her will, insisting they keep it. They do not want it because of what it represents to them, yet they can not bring themselves to dispose of it. following a successful run of fringe shows in 2024 and a finale at The Cockpit in August 2024, Piano Smashers returns. www.pianosmashers.co.uk/ Two superb shows, one fabulous venue. What's not to like? See you there.

This may take a while. A darkly comic grapple with the awkward task of expression, inviting you into the mind of a person who stammers. Partnered with Unlimited; the British Stammering Association; the University of Chichester;  the Mike Howley Trust. Winner of the TicketSource Festival Favourite Award at Cardiff Fringe 2018. www.stammermouth.co.uk/just-a-few-words PIANO SMASHERS Such hidden gems add greatly to the Fringe experience and remind us that among the thousands of shows, there are superb ones which dont get the audiences they deserve.Piano Smashers is one such show. Edinburgh Reporter. 2024. Piano Smashers is a new play by Rupert Page and Rob Thompson in which a mother bequeaths a precious piano to her children in her will, insisting they keep it. They do not want it because of what it represents to them, yet they can not bring themselves to dispose of it. following a successful run of fringe shows in 2024 and a finale at The Cockpit in August 2024, Piano Smashers returns. www.pianosmashers.co.uk/ Two superb shows, one fabulous venue. What's not to like? See you there.

Thursday Night Live

title: Classical Harp by Candlelight
content: Enjoy an exceptional classical harp recital in the beautiful candlelit setting of St Mary Le Strand. A hugely appealing programme by leading harpist.....
location: St Mary Le Strand Church, London WC2R 1ES

sections.content:
Classical Harp by Candlelight


St Mary Le Strand Church, London WC2R 1ES


view on map




Thursday 30 January

Thu 30 Jan 2025, 8:00PM - 9:00PM£20, £30,











Buy Tickets
Spread the word

About this Event

Classical Harp by Candlelight

Enjoy an exceptional classical harp recital in the beautiful candlelit setting of St Mary Le Strand. A hugely appealing programme by leading harpist Esther Beyer to start your weekend in style! There are also a good choice of restaurants and bars nearby to complete your evening FeaturingEsther Beyer (harp) ProgrammeC.P.E Bach - Sonata for Harp in G majorClaude Debussy - Premiere ArabesqueCaroline Lizotte - Suite GalactiqueGabriel Fauré - Impromptu for HarpMarcel Grandjany - Rhapsodie About Esther Beyer Described as “a sparkling presence” by Seen and Heard International (2022), Esther Beyer is an award-winning harpist and educator based in London. Competition successes include first place in the inaugural Royal Academy of Music Bicentenary Prize (held at Wigmore Hall, 2020) and reaching the final of the 2020 Sir Karl Jenkins Music Award (in association with Classic FM). Esther is also a yeoman of The Musician’s Company. Notable solo highlights include performing for HRH Duchess of Cornwall on the Royal Harp at Clarence House. A passionate orchestral musician, Esther has worked with orchestras including the London Philharmonic Orchestra, Royal Liverpool Philharmonic Orchestra, English National Ballet and Northern Ballet, for conductors such as Sir Mark Elder, Edward Gardner and Vasily Petrenko.

llm_output.description: Enjoy an exceptional classical harp recital in the beautiful candlelit setting of St Mary Le Strand. A hugely appealing programme by leading harpist Esther Beyer to start your weekend in style!

sections.content:
Bossa Nova by Mario Bakuna - Live at The Vincent


2 Atkins Square, Dalston Ln,
Hackney, London E8 1FN






Thursday 30 January

7:30PM; £8






www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/bossa-nova-night-tribute-to-joao-gilberto-by-mario-bakuna-londonuk-ti






Buy Tickets
Spread the word

About this Event

Bossa Nova by Mario Bakuna - Live at The Vincent

Mario Bakuna on Acoustic Guitar and Vocals Mario Bakuna performs a concert dedicated to João Gilberto who was a pioneer of the musical genre of Bossa Nova in the late 1950s. Around the world, he was often called “father of Bossa Nova”.Gilberto’s style combines traditional elements of samba with more contemporary jazz. His unique acoustic guitar style involves a syncopated rhythm of plucked chords, with chord progressions rooted in the jazz tradition. Mario will present reinterpretations of some of his compositions and celebrate with the audience one of the greatest Brazilian musicians of all time.

Mario will present reinterpretations of some of his compositions and celebrate with the audience one of the greatest Brazilian musicians of all time.

About this Event

Mozart Piano Concertos by Candlelight

Enjoy an outstanding musical evening with an exceptional selection from Mozart's much-loved Piano Concertos.  Set in the spectacular candlelit venue of St Mary Le Strand Church and featuring a renowned concert pianist Christina Lawrie along with the exceptional  musicians of the The Piccadilly Sinfonietta, this will be a concert to remember! There are also plenty of restaurants and bars nearby to complete your night. 'Stunning' - Classic FM FeaturingThe Piccadilly SinfoniettaChristina Lawrie (piano) ProgrammeMozart - Marriage of FigaroMozart - Eine Kleine NachtmusikMozart - Piano Concerto K466 in D minor Since its formation in 2017, the Piccadilly Sinfonietta has become a regular feature on the UK concert scene, giving over 200 100 performances a year in some of the country’s most beautiful and prestigious venues. The ensemble comprises some of the most prodigious musical talent and performs exclusively with leading virtuoso soloists. The group performs under the artistic direction of its founder, concert pianist Warren Mailley-Smith and focuses on the virtuoso concerto repertoire of the baroque, classical and early romantic periods.

llm_output.description: Enjoy an outstanding musical evening with an exceptional selection from Mozart's much-loved Piano Concertos. Featuring pianist Christina Lawrie and the Piccadilly Sinfonietta, performing Mozart - Marriage of Figaro, Eine Kleine Nachtmusik, and Piano Concerto K466 in D minor.

title: Bach Cello Suites by Candlelight
content: Enjoy an exceptional performance of a selection of J.S. Bach's Solo Cello Suites by renowned cellist, Kirsten Jenson...
location: St Mary Le Strand Church, London WC2R 1ES

sections.content:
Bach Cello Suites by Candlelight


St Mary Le Strand Church, London WC2R 1ES


view on map




Friday 31 January

Fri 31 Jan 2025, 8:00PM - 9:00PM£20, £30, £40











Buy Tickets
Spread the word

About this Event

Bach Cello Suites by Candlelight

Enjoy an exceptional performance of a selection of J.S. Bach's Solo Cello Suites by renowned cellist, Kirsten Jenson. Set in the beautiful candlelit location of St Mary Le Strand, London, it's a hugely appealing programme that will start your weekend in style! There's a good choice of bars and restaurants nearby to complete your night. FeaturingKirsten Jenson (cello) ProgrammeJ.S. Bach - Suite no 1 in G major for solo celloJ.S. Bach - Suite no 2 in D minor for solo celloJ.S. Bach - Suite no 3 in C major for solo cello About Kirsten Jenson A recipient of numerous prizes and awards, Kirsten made her solo debut playing the Schumann Cello Concerto with the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra while studying with renowned soloist and pedagogue Johannes Goritzki. Since then, Kirsten has developed a busy freelance career focussed predominantly on her love of chamber music. After finishing her studies in Switzerland, Kirsten joined the Ragazze Quartet in Holland, with whom she released albums under the label Channel Classics and performed regularly on live TV, radio, and at major venues including the Royal Concertgebouw. Since returning to the UK, Kirsten was awarded Best British Cellist at the 2016 International Music Competition Grand Prize Virtuoso and has guested with numerous ensembles including the historic Allegri Quartet and the Primrose Piano Quartet, and regularly performs as a duo with celebrated pianist John Thwaites.

Set in the beautiful candlelit location of St Mary Le Strand, London, it's a hugely appealing programme that will start your weekend in style! There's a good choice of bars and restaurants nearby to complete your night.
Featuring
Kirsten Jenson (cello)

About this Event

Exit Who?

Mystery writer Crane and her secretary Kate become entangled in a new mystery while renting a country holiday home.It is revealed the house is a dropping place for a micro dot containing important government information. But who is the enemy spy? Watch and see how Crane makes the discovery in this laugh a minute farce.

About this Event

Elthorne Skate Club – TERM 2New & Returning Members Welcome

 Roll into Fun & Fitness with RollaDome’s Roller-Skating Club!   Hey Skate Enthusiasts! Looking for a fun, fit, and friendly atmosphere to sharpen your roller-skating skills? Whether you’re a complete beginner or a returning member ready to dust off those skates, our club has something for everyone!   Why Join Our Roller-Skating Club?   Skill Building: Learn and master fundamental roller-skating techniques, improve your balance, agility, and speed.  Stay Active: Our 11-week terms provide a great workout, promoting overall fitness and well-being. ? Social Skills: Enhance your communication and teamwork skills as you engage with our coaches and fellow skaters.  Inclusive Community: Open to all skill levels and ages 4 and up.  Unbeatable Fun: Our approach to teaching involves continuous assessment paired with a strong emphasis on enjoyment and getting active!  Important Notice:?If the participant has any SEND (Special Educational Needs and Disabilities), is autistic, or has learning difficulties, please note that an additional form will need to be filled out, as you may require 1-to-1 sessions. Kindly complete this additional form – tinyurl.com/2b5rzcpd  Dress to Glide: Opt for jog bottoms, leggings or shorts. No jeans, skirts, ties, dresses, or school uniforms. And don’t forget to bring a drink to stay hydrated!    Flexible Timing Our sessions run every Friday for 11 weeks. Sign up for the term that suits you best. Date & Time: January 17 – April 04 | 4:00 PM – 5:00 PMVenue: Elthorne Sports Centre, Off Westlea Rd, Boston Rd, London W7 2AD, UK Ready to Join the Fun?  Don’t miss out on this incredible opportunity to roll your way into a healthier, happier you. Secure your spot today!  Booking Link:rolladome.org.uk/event/elthorne-skate-club-%f0%9f%8c%88-new-returning-members-welcome-%f0%9f%8c%88-2/

Skill Building: Learn and master fundamental roller-skating techniques, improve your balance, agility, and speed. Stay Active: Our 11-week terms provide a great workout, promoting overall fitness and well-being. Social Skills: Enhance your communication and teamwork skills as you engage with our coaches and fellow skaters. Inclusive Community: Open to all skill levels and ages 4 and up. Unbeatable Fun: Our approach to teaching involves continuous assessment paired with a strong emphasis on enjoyment and getting active!

title: Bach and Vivaldi Violin Concertos by Candlelight
content: The exceptional musicians of the Piccadilly Sinfonietta perform a selection of Bach's magnificent Violin concertos by candlelight in the...
location: St Mary Le Strand Church, London WC2R 1ES

sections.content:
Bach and Vivaldi Violin Concertos by Candlelight


St Mary Le Strand Church, London WC2R 1ES


view on map




Saturday 1 February

6pm-7pm£25, £35, £45











Buy Tickets





03336663366
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

Bach and Vivaldi Violin Concertos by Candlelight

The exceptional musicians of the Piccadilly Sinfonietta perform a selection of Bach's magnificent Violin concertos by candlelight in the beautiful setting of St Mary Le Strand, London.  A hugely appealing evening designed to help you celebrate the weekend in style! There are also plenty of bars and restaurants nearby to complete your night. 'Stunning' - Classic FM Note - there are two performances available: 6pm and 8pm FeaturingThe Piccadilly SinfoniettaVictoria Lyon (violin) Programme Bach - Violin Concerto in E Major, BWV 1042 Bach - Air on a G String (from Orchestral Suite No. 3 in D Major, BWV 1068) Vivaldi - Double Violin Concerto in A Minor, RV 522 Bach - Concerto for Two Violins in D Minor, BWV 1043 Since its formation in 2017, the Piccadilly Sinfonietta have become a regular feature on the UK concert scene, giving over 200 performances a year in some of the country’s most beautiful and prestigious venues. The ensemble comprises some of the most prodigious musical talent and performs exclusively with leading virtuoso soloists. The group performs under the artistic direction of its founder, concert pianist Warren Mailley-Smith and focuses on the virtuoso concerto repertoire of the baroque, classical and early romantic periods. Here's a short video of the Piccadilly Sinfonietta performing: youtu.be/gN157xwtsnM

llm_output.description:
The exceptional musicians of the Piccadilly Sinfonietta perform a selection of Bach's magnificent Violin concertos by candlelight in the beautiful setting of St Mary Le Strand, London.  A hugely appealing evening designed to help you celebrate the weekend in style! There are also plenty of bars and restaurants nearby to complete your night.
Note - there are two performances available: 6pm and 8pm
llm_output.event_name: Bach and Vivaldi Violin Concertos by Candlelight
llm_output.location: St Mary Le Strand Church, London WC2R 1ES
